intro: Rauvolfia obscura, commonly known as the Indian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Asia, particularly India and Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its roots contain alkaloids, such as reserpine, which have been used in traditional medicine for their hypotensive properties. Due to its medicinal value, Rauvolfia obscura is often cultivated for both its therapeutic applications and ornamental appeal.
